title: Installation issue: Update documentation for python(3?)-dev

labels.name: Easy Pickings
labels.description: Used to denote issues that should be easy to implement

### What's your issue about?

Must update documentation to include the need to install python3-dev package on Ubuntu. 

Please include information like:

...

```
Installed /home/collin/vyper-venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pysha3-1.0.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg
Searching for pyethash<1.0.0,>=0.1.27
Reading https://pypi.org/simple/pyethash/
Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/6c/40/5bb02ad7e2fae9b04cd0c391dda81213bc786c30c8381b018600cfc7ce62/pyethash-0.1.27.tar.gz#sha256=ff66319ce26b9d77df1f610942634dac9742e216f2c27b051c0a2c2dec9c2818
Best match: pyethash 0.1.27
Processing pyethash-0.1.27.tar.gz
Writing /tmp/easy_install-3pxnm098/pyethash-0.1.27/setup.cfg
Running pyethash-0.1.27/setup.py -q bdist_egg --dist-dir /tmp/easy_install-3pxnm098/pyethash-0.1.27/egg-dist-tmp-48zrm6gb
src/python/core.c:1:10: fatal error: Python.h: No such file or directory
 #include <Python.h>
          ^~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
error: Setup script exited with error: command 'x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc' failed with exit status 1
Makefile:4: recipe for target 'init' failed
make: *** [init] Error 1

```

...

`sudo apt-get install python3-dev `

...

```
Using /home/collin/vyper-venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rlp-1.0.1-py3.6.egg
Searching for pysha3==1.0.2
Best match: pysha3 1.0.2
Processing pysha3-1.0.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg
pysha3 1.0.2 is already the active version in easy-install.pth

Using /home/collin/vyper-venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pysha3-1.0.2-py3.6-linux-x86_64.egg
Searching for setuptools==39.2.0
Best match: setuptools 39.2.0
Adding setuptools 39.2.0 to easy-install.pth file
Installing easy_install script to /home/collin/vyper-venv/bin
Installing easy_install-3.6 script to /home/collin/vyper-venv/bin

Using /home/collin/vyper-venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages
Finished processing dependencies for vyper==0.1.0b1


```
### How can it be fixed?

`sudo apt-get install python3-dev `
